Articles.Content: I panicked and put no crash damage on, but what do I do now? :/
Just take the failure, there's always room for a 2nd try.
Hope you bounce! You might also want to toggle unbreakable joints and turn off the engines!

If you are okay with the cheating, and don't want to start over, then turn off your engines. Hit "Hack Gravity". Turn on RCS, and hit N to reverse thrust on your RCS jets. This'll move you upwards, since the moon's gravity will be basically zero, at which point you can flip over and try again. (I'm not sure how to un-hack gravity, but exiting and coming back in might work as long as your vessel isn't near the surface.)

Hope you bounce! You might also want to toggle unbreakable joints and turn off the engines!

I have to hold Shift + F1 (because of the way my laptop is) To take screenshots so thats why the engines were on

This'll move you upwards, since the moon's gravity will be basically zero, at which point you can flip over and try again. ty I will try that
Keep thrusting de-orbit the Mun! It's what Jeb would do!
Try not cheating. And then bounce and just go in for a nice landing, re-orienting yourself in mid-air. Also,try alt+f4

Turning off your engines would probably be a good start (Oh I just read your explanation to why they were on) Incidentally you have full fuel, how did you manage that?

Also,try alt+f4

Edited May 8, 2013 by Trux
almost zero velocity and low gravity. Press X start turning and pray you end up thrusting upwards before you hit the ground.
Start using quicksave (f5) and reloading to try again (f9)

Try not cheating. And then bounce and just go in for a nice landing, re-orienting yourself in mid-air. Also,try alt+f4

Anyway, you got a point there... I've once decided to put on "Hack Gravity" while at Kerbin on a test craft I'm working. It never went back to normal.
